audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization - RPA automating transaction processing in healthcare operations. Pattern is replicable across healthcare organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization with specific metric (60M transactions over 4 years), but appears to be from vendor case study which may have marketing bias. Need to verify source authority.
audited_claims.notes: Strong volume metric but vendor source raises credibility concerns

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear efficiency optimization claim. 100% productivity increase is substantial but within bounds for RPA implementations in repetitive tasks.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific quantified claim from named organization, but 100% productivity increase is a round number that may indicate approximation rather than precise measurement. Vendor source adds bias risk.
audited_claims.notes: Significant but plausible productivity claim; vendor source requires scrutiny

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization of documentation processes - core administrative function in healthcare. Highly replicable pattern.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (40% reduction) from named organization. Documentation time reduction is measurable and credible for RPA implementation.

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. This case describes RPA optimization of existing healthcare administrative processes - clear functional improvements in efficiency, accuracy, and cost reduction within established business model. No business model transformation or new revenue streams indicated.
